newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London steady in thin business.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London steady in thin business.

text.p: Hong Kong shares traded in London were modestly higher early afternoon in very quiet business, dealers said.
"It's been a very tight trading range today - no features whatsoever," said one. "A slight rise in Hong Kong Bank (HSBC) accounts for the rise in the index on a little bit of demand for the banks."
The rest of the market opened around the Hong Kong close, continuing to trade at that level on very little turnover.
The Hang Seng London Reference index was up 9.53 points at 11,389.02 by 1322 GMT.
Overnight, the Hang Seng closed 40.56 points higher at 11,379.49 as late buying of laggard stocks helped lift the index from its session low of 11,295.53.
